effect:

- Discarded after use.

name: Informant
effect: - Each turn, allows 1 card on top of an opponent Discard Pile to be moved to the bottom of that Discard Pile.

name: Information Leak
effect:
- Look at one opponent's next undrawn card and either discard it, along with one card from your hand, or put it back.
- Discarded after use.

name: Insanity [O5]
effect:
- Played on a crew card of equal or lesser strength.
- Insanity player dictates the actions of that card on the crew player's turn.
- May do normal functions, or the opposite of: point generation, point modification, card plays and card draws.
- Negated by research equal to the insanity plus the crew's strength.
- Crew may not be voluntarily discarded.

name: Insanity [O9]
effect:
- Crew card (of equal or lesser strength) on which it is played functions irrationally.
- Insanity player dictates the actions of that crew card on the crew player's turn.
- May do normal functions, or the opposite of: point generation, point modification, card plays and card draws.
- Negated by research equal to the insanity plus the crew's strength.
- Crew card may not be discarded in Discard Phase.

name: Instant Reaction
effect:
- Played to a reaction card in play in the fleet, once each opponent phase.
- Allows that card to react as if it were just played in reaction mode from the hand to any location.
- Immediately return this card to hand if the affected reaction card is of equal or lesser strength. Immediately discard this card otherwise.

name: Intercept Action
effect:
Allows any ship in play in the fleet to intercept damage scored on another ship or base.
- 2 points of damage are scored for every point intercepted.
- Discarded after use.

name: Intergalactic Void
effect: - Each turn, 1 ship played to the intergalactic void is played in the engaged position.

name: Interplanetary Conflict
effect:
Played against two terrain cards belonging to one opponent:
- Each sustains damage equal to 1/2 the strength of the other (round fractions down).
- Neither can produce terrain points on that player's next turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Interstellar Plasma
effect:
Unstable material which regenerates hazards and terrain. Does 1 of the following:
- All damage points to terrain cards in owner's fleet are repaired.
- At the instant this card is played any hazard cards played by the owner on opponent fleets are repaired and are considered played anew (reapply initial effects immediately, restart duration count).
- Discarded after use.

name: Invinco Guardian
effect:
An invinco guardian is a friendly monster which protects a ship by forming itself into an energy barrier around the ship.
- Must always be played on the lowest strength ship in a player's fleet.
- Absorbs all damage taken by the ship until the guardian itself is destroyed.
- Invinco guardians may not be healed.

name: Ion Storm [H2]
effect:
Ion storms are hazardous zones of hyper-accelerated ions occurring in areas of intense gravity.
- May only be played against base or ship cards.
- Causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength.
- Discarded after use.

name: Ion Storm [H5]
effect:
The hyper-accelerated ions occurring in ion storms make these areas hazardous to units.
- Played against ships or bases.
- Causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength.
- Discarded after use.

name: Ionized Particle Field
effect:
Some asteroid fields are ionized with solar impressers. This allows energy to be collected at moderate levels for a short period.
- Provides 4 energy on its first Allocation Phase, 3 on the second, 2 on the third and 1 on the fourth.
- Discarded after 4 turns.

name: Visilikiiy's Eye
effect:
Visilikiiy's Eye is a large eye-shaped creature of near planetary proportions. It possesses omniscient powers. May do 1 of the following each turn:
- Look at 1 card in an opponent hand.
- Look at the card on top of an opponent's deck.
- Look at an opponent's entire hand. The eye is discarded with this use.

name: Void Angel
effect:
This obscure space entity attaches itself to a crew or dragon card which has at least 1 ability card.
- When the crew or dragon is killed all ability cards are transferred to another crew or dragon card (same type only) of equal or higher strength.
- If no such card is available then the ability cards are discarded along with the void angel.

name: Volatile Terrain
effect:
Stellar explosions are extremely volatile.
- Played to a terrain card just destroyed by weapons fire.
- All units which caused damage to the terrain take damage equal to the strength of the terrain.
- Discarded after use.

name: Vymezies Matter
effect:
Spirits that animate asteroids or smaller stellar matter.
- Played against terrain cards of equal or lesser strength. That terrain provides no points until the vymezies matter is destroyed.
- Causes damage [Generated Points: ☓☓☓☓] each turn to any unit in the fleet to which it's played.
- Destroyed by damage points.

name: Wandering Desire
effect:
- Causes the Indirigan ship on which it is played to be discarded (placed back into hand if the Indirigans are the main fleet in that deck).
- Cannot be played on Indirigan ships with a crew card of higher strength than this card.
- Strengths of multiple wandering desires can be combined.
- Discarded after use.

name: Warp Engine Breach
effect:
A warp engine breech causes an internal explosion.
- Played against a ship, but not against a dragon.
- Ship takes structural damage equal to 1/2 its strength.
- Discarded after use.

name: Warp Field Destabilization Gun
effect:
- May be fired at one ship or base each turn. May not be fired at the same unit two turns in a row.
- The target card requires 3 times its normal engagement energy requirement on its next turn.
- Corporate foreign technology.

name: Warp Funnel
effect:
This phenomenon appears suddenly, accelerating a ship in a random direction.
- Played to a ship.
- Causes 1 point of damage [Generated Points: ☓] per turn.
- Prevents a ship from protecting its Sector HQ.
- Four points of weapons damage is required to eliminate a warp funnel.

name: Weapons Officer
effect:
Illustration:
A Bolaar Weapons Officer.
A weapons officer provides the following benefits to his location:
- All weapon damage allocated to each target is multiplied by 1.5 (drop fractions).
- Ignores the negative effects of electronic warfare cards.

name: Zarom
effect:
Jet-like boring creatures which eat in swarms. Zarom eat space monsters and dragons.
Played against a fleet:
- Causes 1 point of damage [Generated Points: ☓] each turn to all monsters and dragons in the fleet.
- Destroyed by research points equal to its strength.

name: ﻿Infestation Inhibitor
effect: - Allows the doctor, nurse, EMT or science officer on which this card is played to negate (discard) a Filarian Infester card (and the crew its played on) at its location. The Filarian Infester must be of equal or lesser strength than the doctor, nurse, EMT or science officer.
